page.title: 12Local customs
page.content: There are many customs still in the area. The Morris Dancers perform regularly from May Day at St.Mary's Church until September. These dates mark the beginning and ending of the Old Agricultural Year - seed time to harvest. The dances reflect the old beliefs that the gods had to be pleased and the evil spirits driven away to ensure good crops. The pram race is run for charity. It starts at the British Legion club in Buckingham road and visits all the local public houses. The participants all wear fancy dress. The Bath tub race is run in August for charity on the river Adur from Bramber bridge to the Norfolk bridge. People and organisations build a variety of rafts and boats to go down the river. There is a prize for the winner and the best decorated bath tub.
